image.altText: A woman with brown hair pulled back smiles, she wears a brown top, sitting at a computer desk

props.synopsis: From using non-scented cleaning products to removing light bulbs from above some desks, an Adelaide data firm running a program to train and employ young neurodiverse people is making small office changes to help them succeed.

title.children: Data firm creates program to help neurodiverse people succeed in workforce

image.altText: Two shopping trolleys in a car park

props.synopsis: A  woman is stabbed in an Adelaide shopping centre car park by her father in what prosecutors described as an "attempted honour-killing". One academic says this is just one case of thousands that occur globally every year.

title.children: A 21yo Australian woman was stabbed in a shopping car park in a case of 'honour-based' violence

image.altText: Bill Shorten at a press conference

props.synopsis: NDIS Minister Bill Shorten defends reforms to the disability scheme passed last week, saying the $14 billion in savings come from "cost reductions", not cuts.

title.children: 'This is not a cut': Shorten defends NDIS reforms that will save government $14b

image.altText: Side by side of two pandas

props.synopsis: Two new pandas will replace Wang Wang and Fu Ni when the beloved pair return to China later this year.

title.children: Adelaide Zoo reveals new panda pair as crowds farewell Wang Wang and Fu Ni

image.altText: A middle aged white woman with long blonde hair sitting on a park bench

props.synopsis: Annual drug overdose deaths in Australia have almost doubled over the past 20 years. Advocates say it's time governments change the way they tackle the issue.

title.children: When police came to her door, Jen was worried her daughter had been arrested. The reality was far worse

image.altText: Jonathan Simonds wears anti-war badges including one that says 'not another bomb'.

props.synopsis: While America's Democratic diehards enjoyed pep talks and pop music at their party-vibes convention this week, a smaller panel event on the sidelines was striking a very different tone.

title.children: Why some Democrats think a 'boneheaded mistake' could threaten Kamala Harris's election chances

image.altText: Drone exploding mid air with orange fire and flames coming out of the back

props.synopsis: The Lebanese militant group Hezbollah says it has launched an attack on Israel, as Israel stages strikes inside Lebanon earlier.

title.children: Hezbollah launches attack on Israel with large number of drones, as Israel stages strikes inside Lebanon

image.altText: Orange skyline with smoke and fire on Lebanese side of the border

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says it has launched strikes inside Lebanon targeting Hezbollah as the militant group says it has deployed drones as part of an attack on Israeli. Follow live.

title.children: Israel declares security emergency as Hezbollah launches rockets and drone attacks

image.altText: Chris Pearson portrait

props.synopsis: An inquiry ordered following a Four Corners investigation into the Public Trustee concluded that the agency's actions "in the main … were appropriate". Refunds and a misplaced account tell a different story.

title.children: Facing questions from the ABC, the Public Trustee found a client's misplaced account containing $73,000

props.synopsis: Police use a taser to arrest a man at the scene of a crash and suspected stabbings at a busy intersection in Sydney's southern outskirts.

title.children: Police say man was driving when he stabbed woman in passenger seat and crashed car in Sydney

image.altText: Ruins of a stone building and a more modern building with a tin roof.

props.synopsis: For some people, tasting the pies made in the outback South Australian town of Farina is a bucket-list activity. The pies are cooked in an underground bakery in the otherwise deserted town, with the proceeds going towards restoring Farina's ruins.

title.children: Welcome to Farina, the South Australian outback ghost town where the meat pies are to die for

image.altText: A Carlton AFL player with "Blues 9" on his shirt smiles as he gestures with his hands before a game.

props.synopsis: An under-strength Carlton side faces a danger game against St Kilda at Docklands, after Marcus Bontempelli and the Bulldogs withstand wild weather — and the Giants — to clinch finals footy. Follow live.

title.children: Banged-up Blues face Saints in must-win clash at Docklands, as Dogs clinch September spot

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: QT: St Kilda Saints 2.2 (14) lead Carlton Blues 1.3 (9)
What does this game mean for Carlton?
FT: Western Bulldogs 14.14 (98) defeat GWS Giants 9.7 (61)

image.altText: Albanese and Bullock

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says he won't abolish the government's power to overrule the Reserve Bank, but he will try to restrict its ability to be used.

title.children: The government will keep its power to overrule the RBA. Even though it's never been used

image.altText: Half a dozen special police forces stand in full helmet and camo gear

props.synopsis: German police detain a man they say went on a stabbing rampage in the west German city of Solingen, killing three people and injuring eight others.

title.children: Suspect in fatal knife attack at German festival arrested, officials say

image.altText: Two women standing on a rocky beach beside palm trees

props.synopsis: This last undeveloped headland on Cairns' northern beaches is now at the centre of a fierce fight between the Queensland government and opposition as the state election looms.

title.children: The $8m 'slice of paradise' at the heart of a battle for one of Queensland's marginal state seats

image.altText: A man with dark hair holds the face of a serious looking woman with blonde hair and blue eyes

props.synopsis: Any efforts to kickstart conversations about abuse should be applauded. But as a serious reflection of what domestic violence is really like, It Ends With Us falls short.

title.children: The truth of violent marriages is lost when Hollywood refuses to face the dark reality

image.altText: A woman holding a silver trophy while wearing white gloves

props.synopsis: Theodore Tennis Club has six courts, 123 members, a modest clubhouse and a trophy cabinet with an impressive display.

title.children: Tennis star gifts championship trophy to tiny hometown club

image.altText: Mountainous rocks peek through surrounding gum tree forests.

props.synopsis: There are hundreds of dormant and extinct volcanoes across south-east Australia. They aren't likely to burst into life but it is "almost a given" that a new volcano will form somewhere else, according to a geosciences lecturer.

title.children: New volcanoes will erupt in Australia's south-east but whether that could happen in 100 years — or 5,000 — isn't known

image.altText: A yellow sign says footpath closed and yellow

props.synopsis: Seismologist Michael Turnbull predicts "reasonably sized" earthquakes of at least magnitude 3 could hit the area for the next couple of months.

title.children: Aftershocks expected to rattle the NSW Upper Hunter for months

image.altText: Man draped in Ukrainian flag with shaved head among crowd

props.synopsis: It is the seventh such exchange the UAE has mediated since Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022.

title.children: First prisoner swap since Ukraine incursion into Russia sees 230 people released

image.altText: Lia Finocchiaro smiles and celebrates the election victory.

props.synopsis: The NT's new incoming chief minister Lia Finocchiaro and the CLP have won a commanding majority government, with a mandate to lower crime rates and fix the territory's lagging economy.

title.children: Landslide victory for the CLP in NT election, as party steamrolls Labor in Darwin heartland

image.altText: An overhead shot of a town with houses and red dirt.

props.synopsis: Once thriving gold rush towns in Western Australia's Murchison region now lie deserted. There's fears other towns could be headed the same way.

title.children: With millions of dollars trucked out and very little coming back in, what do these remote mining towns do to survive?

image.altText: A thumbnail showing different fires caused by battery faults.

props.synopsis: New South Wales has reported 185 lithium ion battery fires up until August this year, with more than six battery fires per week. Fire and Rescue NSW has referred to battery fires as "the fastest growing fire risk" in the state.

title.children: 'Fastest-growing fire risk': Exploding everyday items now 'top issue' for fire authorities

image.altText: Sunita Williams and Butch WIlmore

props.synopsis: Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams — stuck in space since June — will have to wait until next year for a ride home.

title.children: NASA decides astronauts stranded in space will return home in February

image.altText: Missing man Jake Lyons

props.synopsis: Jake Lyons disappeared from his Dandenong home exactly 10 years ago today, leaving a trail of unanswered questions.

title.children: Family of missing Melbourne man Jake Lyons search for answers in decade-long cold case

image.altText: About 10 women in bathing suits swimming in the sea.

props.synopsis: Before dawn, Williamstown Beach in Melbourne's inner west is alive with the giggles of those braving the winter seawater, who turn out each day regardless of the weather forecasts, or the warnings issued by Victoria's Environment Protection Agency.

title.children: At a beach in Melbourne's industrial west, 'pollution is a concern' but it rarely stops these swimmers

image.altText: Takuya Shiota wears full PPE including a breathing mask with a white hood tightened around the outside of his face as he cleans.

props.synopsis: Dying a lonely death is an increasing problem in Japan, and it's not just due to its aging population, with a lack of community among the factors isolating people.

title.children: As Japan ages, a terrifying proposition is emerging: Dying alone and no-one finding your body for years

image.altText: Sun breaks through the trees on the driveway out of Avatar's Abode.

props.synopsis: Safekeepers of Avatar's Abode, a 40-hectare Sunshine Coast property that's dedicated to global spiritual leader Meher Baba, are confident they will preserve the site for centuries.

title.children: 'Hidden jewel' on Sunshine Coast has links to a global spiritual leader, but some locals are unaware it exists

image.altText: The Paralympic Flame is lit in England ahead of the 2024 Paris Games.

props.synopsis: With the Paris opening ceremony only days away, the Paralympic Flame is lit in Stoke Mandeville, an English village widely considered the birthplace of the Games.

title.children: Paralympic Flame lit before beginning exceptional journey to Paris

image.altText: To Lam sitting down on a chair with two microphones in front of him on a lectern.

props.synopsis: Former minister of public security To Lam has rapidly ascended to power in Vietnam, taking on two of the four roles considered the "pillars" of the country's political system. Some are already comparing him to Xi Jinping.

title.children: To Lam's rise to power in Vietnam has been 'spectacular'. Could he be following Xi Jinping's blueprint?

image.altText: BluLink live stream

props.synopsis: Members of the public can now click on a link that is sent to their smartphone when they call triple-0. A limited trial has already been used in cases including the fatal Bondi Junction stabbing in April.

title.children: People who call triple-0 in NSW can now live stream their emergency to police

image.altText: A man dressed in a suit speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Dr Fauci, 83, is now recovering at home after spending about seven days in hospital after being bitten by an infected mosquito.

title.children: Anthony Fauci in recovery after week-long hospitalisation with West Nile virus

image.altText: A young girl with dark hair in plaits lies in a hospital bed surrounded by greeting cards and soft toys

props.synopsis: She wants stronger age restrictions for unsupervised riding to help prevent further incidents.

title.children: Mum's plea to restrict e-scooters after daughter suffers life-threatening injuries
